definitions.definition: A conversation or other form of discourse between two or more individuals.
definitions.example: Bill and Melinda maintained a dialogue via email over the course of their long-distance relationship.

definitions.definition: (authorship) In a dramatic or literary presentation, the verbal parts of the script or text; the verbalizations of the actors or characters.
definitions.example: The movie had great special effects, but the dialogue was lackluster.

definitions.definition: A literary form, where the presentation resembles a conversation.
definitions.example: A literary historian, she specialized in the dialogues of ancient Greek philosophers.
Once the My Computer dialogue opens, select Local Disk (C:), then right click and scroll down.

definitions.definition: To discuss or negotiate so that all parties can reach an understanding.
definitions.example: Pearson wanted to dialogue with his overseas counterparts about the new reporting requirements.

definitions.definition: To take part in a dialogue; to dialogize.
